Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Temporin-Ra (Leu-rich; UCLL1; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against E. coli HP101BA 7601c (MIC 24.2 ug/ml), S. dysgalactiae PTCC 1074 (MIC 33.2 ug/ml), S. agalactiae PTCC 1365 (MIC 24.7 ug/ml), S. aureus PTCC 1431 (MIC 35.2 ug/ml), and K. pneumoniae PTCC 1388 (MIC 31.2 ug/ml).SAR: Synthetic C-terminally amidated peptide is active against S. aureus (MIC 7.76 ug/ml), but not active against E.coli (MIC 317 ug/ml) and A.baumannii (MIC 158 ug/ml).Toxicity: The peptide showed a dose-deppendnet effect on bllod cells and about 1.1% hemolysis at 60 ug/ml.Chemical modification: Although not reported, the peptide is likely amidated at the C-terminus.Structure: Synthetic C-terminally amidated peptide is helical in the presence of 50% or 100% TFE or POPG (Lopes et al., 2022). Also provided by Ahmad Asoodeh. Updated 7/2021; 8/2022
Literature Information.Author: Asoodeh A, Zardini HZ, Chamani J.2011, Iran, Asia
Literature Information.Reference: J Pept Sci. 2012 Jan;18(1):10-6. doi: 10.1002/psc.1409. Epub 2011 Sep 29.PubMed.
Literature Information.Title: Identification and characterization of two novel antimicrobial peptides, temporin-Ra and temporin-Rb, from skin secretions of the marsh frog (Rana ridibunda)
